3B3E0AC370104609BADBCB4FAA333016.description: plan, create, organize, and present an age appropriate media product that demonstrates an understanding of format, purpose, audience, and choice of medium.

5142AAE18FFC4F14AEEE35DCC46D23E5.description: properly use private and public information.

8BC7289EDF724E9DAAD202CC3A9C318E.description: understand, evaluate and create media communications.

FCA61E58D41D4802922B4844CD1327AD.description: adapt and use active listening strategies to evaluate the message, formulate a strategy and respond to: intended purpose, make predictions, construct meaning from discussion/speech/media, critique presentation

0CFF8E9E4E3445B4B2EFCB8EA548E659.description: model a variety of roles in various settings to listen actively, understand the intended message, evaluate, enjoy and/or respond to an oral message: critique oral/visual information, collaborate to achieve a goal, deliver an extended extemporaneous speech, relate experiences in third person, mediate to reach a consensus, participate in a panel/round table discussion

D58170B580BD4BB1802D74A2ED6F769D.description: formulate and deliver grammatically correct messages, as well as evaluate and adapt strategies for developing credibility, such as speaking truthfully and creating clear and logical messages (e.g., supporting ideas with evidence and emotional appeals in light of purpose, audience and context).

A903B423E2464B598D3B9747BA519AB7.description: plan, research background of topic, and communicate in different settings (e.g. interpersonal, small group, whole group, panel, round table, debate) and for different purposes: inform, persuade, relate, entertain

55B9082B254E4C9DAB6A2F32DE97646C.description: develop a research topic, select approaches, write and publish a well-developed research project with documented and cited sources and computer-generated graphics, following a specified format: MLA, APA, Chicago

81172A112EDD47BC99808F73F3CBF3AF.description: select revision and editing strategies to correct errors in and improve organization, content, usage, mechanics and spelling. In the proofreading process, integrate the use of: dictionary, spell check, thesaurus, style sheet, or guide

23256046BB124B61B2B3D420192D2D5C.description: revise sentences to create specific effects, variety and more precise and concise language: gerund phrase, participle phrase, infinitive phrase, clauses

79DD0F75AA6F4BEC93593D8A0D895FFF.description: incorporate different transitional sentences to signal progression of ideas within and between paragraphs as well as appropriate phrases to signal organizational patterns.

D3C405F7CDF948D5AEEEF7651382AFA9.description: summarize, paraphrase, and use direct quotations correctly and effectively in a writing/research project in order to avoid plagiarism; recognize copyright laws and public/private domain.

50C5677BD6AA4E2D93B1774476A869B6.description: classify and prioritize different drafting strategies for specific writing tasks to frame a clear, logical progression of ideas in argumentative writing, research writing, literary analysis, and creative and reflective writing.

79B0295C81D347C9B7DC9BE6976F07B6.description: plan and incorporate varied note taking skills to organize and synthesize information from print and electronic sources (e.g., Internet research, electronic databases for periodicals and newspapers, print reference materials) into an outline for a composition or research project (introduction, thesis/hypothesis, main points, supporting details/examples, conclusion).

A49506A50713457492046CA3124167F0.description: formulate a working research question and identify, organize and consider the relevance of known information to guide further research.

5BBFE9A144734C4FBC39868CF26C2CEE.description: evaluate, analyze, and synthesize into one’s writing a variety of informational media using primary and secondary sources.

276664FCE6524E649A2EBEEECFD312E6.description: construct a clearly worded and effectively placed thesis statement to develop a composition that addresses the assigned topic.

BED3733031614BF3BEE9EA319874AA1F.description: Define topic from assigned subject/prompt and compose narrative, informative, descriptive and persuasive writings using the five-step writing process (pre-writing, drafting, revising, editing, publishing) for specific audiences by employing writing strategies that are modeled in various types of literature.

E3406CC604654E0E97999CB244A17D72.description: Critique persuasive language and techniques as found in literary and informational texts and media.

E0EE43FCFFC146EABEF1D909421EBF2B.description: Extend vocabulary by developing and using new terms and phrases found in reading classical literature and informational texts using various strategies:  context clues • affixes • suffixes • multiple meanings • etymologies

84D5E8019A594AF6B3A3D77657174D10.description:
Analyze the organizational patterns (e.g. problem- solution,
cause-and-effect, textual features including table of contents, headings,
sidebars, marginal notes, graphical representations such as tables, timelines, captions, maps, photographs) and ideas in
informational and literary texts.

C42CBF4A883140C6A11D7A7BB1593E89.description:
Interpret and explain the relationships of the literary
elements (e.g., setting, plot, , point of view, theme, conflict,
characterization, voice, tone, mood) within specific genres.

3A0665EDE5FB4BE8A87D388522D88092.description:
Interpret and explain the author’s choice of literary devices used to
construct meaning and define the author’s/reader’s purpose: symbolism, imagery, irony, satire, cadence, scansion,  flashback, foreshadowing, Freytag’s pyramid

640B6DAFA5B148668E61C9ED566DAB56.description:
Create
supportable predictions, generalizations, opinions, inferences and
conclusions based upon an analysis of
textual information.

B57D9AE3F4154DCC936566E31AB3D57C.description:
Evaluate the author’s use of specific information in text
(e.g., author’s purpose/perspective, main/supporting details, specific facts,
statistics, definition, figurative/nonfigurative words).

5FEA3C4D6375487E8E7E11EAC068AF3E.description: apply various pre-reading skills and comprehension strategies for activating prior knowledge and asking questions during reading and post reading for  literary experience • examining textual information • performing an assigned task

D4661DB5FEBC48099B84B26321FC35A8.description: Extend the amount of independent reading with emphasis on fiction and nonfiction.

6E99052A328E44DE91FBFC520318666E.description:
Compare and contrast literary styles according to
genre.

86466073035244CB985F3FC76B6F332C.description:
Research and analyze historical, cultural, and
biographical influences on literary and informational texts.
